0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: PET brain study, To estimate beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in patients with cognitive impairment: 300 megabecquerels (8.1 millicuries) via slow IV bolus (6 sec/mL) followed by 10 mL saline flush; MAX 30 mcg mass dose

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: not indicated for use in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
PET brain study, To estimate beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in patients with cognitive impairment

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• image interpretation errors may occur, especially false positives; interpretation should be independent of clinical information
  • radiopharmaceutical; ensure safe handling to reduce radiation exposure to personnel and patient
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Erythema at injection site (1.7%), Injection site irritation (1.2%), Injection site pain (3.9%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Florbetaben 18 F binds to beta-amyloid neuritic plaques in the brain. In vitro, florbetaben 18 F demonstrates binding affinity to synthetic beta-amyloid fibrils and to Alzheimer disease (AD) brain homogenate and to beta-amyloid plaques in post-mortem AD brain sections. In vivo, quantitative correlation was not assessed in end-of-life patients between florbetaben 18 F uptake in cortical grey matter and the beta-amyloid deposition in autopsied samples.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • radiation protection precautions in accordance with national regulations must be taken; use waterproof gloves and maintain adequate shielding
  • do not dilute
  • measure with a dose calibrator immediately prior to administration
  • test catheter patency with saline prior to administration
  • administer by slow IV bolus injection (6 sec/mL) in large arm vein, followed by a 10-mL saline flush to ensure full delivery of the dose
  • any unused portion must be disposed of according to local requirements

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• enhancement and identification of beta-amyloid plaques upon positron emission tomography (PET) imaging of the brain is indicative of efficacy.
  • pregnancy status; prior to initiating therapy in women of childbearing potential

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Instruct patients of childbearing potential that drug may cause fetal harm.
  • Advise breastfeeding women to interrupt breastfeeding for 24 hours following injection. Discard expressed feeds during this time.
  • Side effects may include injection site pain, irritation, or erythema.
